header.title: A Small Ulta Haul & Ageism At Its Best
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: Let's talk Ulta , make up and ageism at its best

commentThread.commentText: You are so right about the medical community.  It's almost like they figure we are gonna die soon so why bother.  That's why I think an older person needs an advocate or 2 to attend the doctor appointments with the patient.  The advocates need to speak up and say "don't write this person off.  They are vital to their family and community.  There is lots of life left in them". You are not mistaken about this attitude toward the mature.  70 and older is still young and not ready to be left to die.  I think it is just terrible

replies.commentText: Cindy, it is devastating for those without a voice of their own and I'm sure this dirty little secret is not shared with most people.  We need to educate those not only in the health care industry but in any service that impacts the aging.

commentThread.commentText: Hi Hun. I totally agree with you about the sponge applicators on the end of products. My favourite concealer is Maybelline The Eraser Eye, but it has that Sponge......big hugs......Bella xxxx🌺🌺🌺

My mom had open heart surgery in her seventies and two other very serious surgeries later in her early 80's. She lived to be just days shy of her 93rd birthday. Never did her doctors say anything like that to us. When a doctor is that negative, it's time to find another one. Gerri, your skin is gorgeous and I love your makeup. Be blessed ... xoxo

replies.commentText: Nikki, I'm sure most doctors would t say that to people. I think in both cases with me they were confiding in me, having been in the business for a number of years. My aunt lived till she was 95 and my mother died at 81. Longevity is certainly more prevalent today.

commentThread.commentText: Geri, how old are you? If you don't mind me asking because you look as if you will certainley live another ten years. I am 84yrs young and have started wearing makeup. So no way am I going to die soon and give up so much fun. My doc said last time that he has 3 patients over 100 and many in their 90,s. He is very young and no way does he want me to give up. I think you have too much product on your eyes but what do I know. Love you and your channel.

replies.commentText: Faye, he wasn't talking about me. He was confiding in me. I'm sure he wouldn't have said that if he thought I didn't have a lot of time left.

commentThread.commentText: Geri, your comments on ageism stunned me! I personally know loads of people in their 70s who have had successful heart surgery, for one. This sounds like plain old insurance cost-cutting to me. Have you considered complaining to your doctor's superiors? Such blatant discrimination is depressing--which definitely isn't good for anyone's health. Many people decide not to pursue zillions of tests, just as some forego treatment--not necessarily because of thei r age, but sometimes, yes. That should be the individual's prerogative, not medical policy.

replies.commentText: Lexicron, these were two very well thought of physicians with great credentials who were confiding in me, forgetting I was in the demographic they were talking about. Whether or not they verbalize it, it is clearly the thinking of a lot of people and frightening.

commentThread.commentText: Love your look today Geri!! Tati does do great makeup I watch her too!! You did a great job very pretty! xoxoxoxo Hugs! Carol

replies.commentText: I love Tati and I love trying new things.

commentThread.commentText: They are starting to play God!!
it's all about our health care going down the tubes

replies.commentText: denise, I know!  These changes are not good.

commentThread.commentText: The Benefit Watt's Up is a stick. If you remove the base of that tube the stick should twist out there. The other end is used to blend it.

replies.commentText: Marla, duh!  Too bad I couldn't figure that out. Thanks.

commentThread.commentText: Hi Geri, I can't believe he said that. But I am not surprised. But so many people are living in there 80s and 90s and beyond and in good health. So they need to do these things. Anyway, you look radiant. Hope you have a Good Friday. As you know, I am a fairly new subscriber. I so enjoy your channel. 🌸

replies.commentText: Debbie, I'm so happy you're enjoying the videos. What these ageist statements suggest is that we are not valued as we age and that is a sad commentary. Thanks for those kind words.

commentThread.commentText: Regarding ageism. What the you know what!! I just started back going to the gym because well I need to and I just want to feel better. The guy they assign to me is 84 years old but I didn't know hi s age until he told me and I could not believe he was th at age because He just didn't look t hat age (hell I don't know what age suppose to look like anymore) he really looked like he w as my age which is 64 that's 20 years younger than he looked. He was handsome too... tall good looking man in great shape he was one of the people who worked at the gym so tell me please wh at are Doctors and people in general thinking...that once you turned a certain age you going to die and just give up.... what is it... what are they thinking... don't they know we are living longer taking better care if our selves and they too if they are lucky one hope to live a long and healthy life. "What the ...."

replies.commentText: linda, it's alarming how little value they put on us as we age. It's tantamount to sending us out to that iceberg.

commentThread.commentText: Hi Geri, I saw a video on this highlighter.  It looked like she pulled from the other end.  Her highlighter was on the bottom and then she closed it and used the sponge on the top to spread it.  Of course they could have changed the packaging!!

replies.commentText: Now I feel like an idiot, even though Idid try to turn the other side.  Didn't realize I had to pull it off.  Thank you so much!!!
Geri, no don't feel like an idiot.  The person I watched was having problems with it too!!!  But glad you got it open!!!  Hugs to you!!!
